result.execSummary:
The defendant Debra L. Terwilliger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Penalty - Retail Theft (>$500 - $5000)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay at the rate of $25.00 per month, starting September 15, 2015 and on the same day thereafter, until paid in full.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  $15.00 payment plan fee added.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Debra L. Terwilliger

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Debra L. Terwilliger
Current: 320 N. Division St., Loyal, WI 54446 United States  (Effective: 09-14-2016)
Prior: 206 N. Main Street, #1, Greenwood, WI 54437

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney French.  Count 1 amended to misdemeanor theft, as PTAC.  Granted.  Victim notification complied with.  State requesting $157.18 restitution to victim, joint and several with co-defendant. Defense did not know about restitution request.  Defense requests a restitution hearing.  Defendant plead no contest to amended Count 1.  Court advised the charge and possible penalties of the charge she plead to.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered her plea and waived her constitutional rights.  Court finds that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of amended Count 1.   Joint recommendation for fine, plus costs.  Defendant did not exercise her right to allocution.  Court ordered:  $100, plus costs.  Total $589.00.  Pay at the rate of $25/mo starting 9/15/15.     Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
Attorney French requested the prelim on 6/19/15 be canceled; Melissa confirmed.  Requested a plea/sentencing be scheduled at the end of August.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on Officer Dean Taylor to appear at the prelim on 6-19-15

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: Brian B or Black River Falls Wal-Mart.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney French.  Reading of complaint waived.  Time limits for preliminary hearing waived.  Court questioned defendant on her understanding of the waiver of time limits.  Court found defendant waived time limits for preliminary hearing.  Bond set.  PTC & STC dates set.

Pre-trial conference at 04-22-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 05-11-2015 03:00 pm.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: Brian B or Black River Falls Wal-Mart.
